title: Saudi mothers’ perception of their children with attention‐deficit hyperactivity disorder in Dammam, Al‐Qatif, and Al‐Khobar cities, Saudi Arabia
abstract: Background: Mothers' perceptions about attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) are central to the management of the disorder. The aim of the study was to assess the knowledge, experiences, and attitudes of mothers with ADHD children toward ADHD and identify their common sources of information and service barriers from the perspectives of these mothers in the Dammam, AI-Khobar, and Al-Qatif areas.
